final_answer:
This image is satirical because it humorously critiques societal beauty standards. On the left, the "Shouting Person" is angrily tearing apart a detailed "Beauty Standards Paper," representing frustration with complex and arbitrary beauty metrics. This symbolizes the rejection of unrealistic expectations placed on people.

On the right, the "Calm Person" is contentedly holding a simplified "Beauty Standards Poster" with ">180," likely referring to height in centimeters. It pokes fun at how quickly such standards can be reduced to a simplistic, yet still unreasonable, measure. The contrast between the two sides, along with the straightforward format of "YES, BUT," highlights the absurdity of setting rigid beauty criteria, making it both funny and thought-provoking.
